item.title: Report E-2024080444
item.description:
Report E-2024080444

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: MERCERVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CARTAGE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 15, 2024, at 1841 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Mercerville, New Jersey regarding the release of Allnex SETAL 26-1089 (UN1866, Resin Solution, 3, III). Terminal personnel reported that 1 cup was released from (1) 55-gallon DM due to being improperly loaded and impacted the dock and trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release and staged the waste onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024080006
item.description:
Report I-2024080006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: BERLIN
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LPG LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: July 8, 2024: On this date a driver for LPG Logistics USDOT 3142354 (C Three Logistics USDOT 2961868) was delivering the above listed material to a client in Berlin NJ. The Driver and receiver's operator failed to ensure the hose was empty of product prior to disconnecting the hose. The material within the hose ( Approx 5-20 gallons) spilled on the ground. The area was immediately secured. The product was contained with dry absorbent and absorbing pads and properly disposed of via an authorized recovery company. The report is being submitted at the request of the manufacturer/shipper. No injuries, deaths, fire, waterway involvement. NRC notified on 7-9-24 NRC # 1404204. NJDEP 24-07-09-1610-25 (Closed)
